name: High dose opiates
title: Prescribing of high dose opiates
compared with prescribing of opiates
why_it_matters: The project seeks to
improve prescribing of opioid analgesia.  There is little evidence that opioids are helpful in long term pain,
and the risk of harm increases significantly above 120mg morphine (or equivalent) per day, without much increase in benefit.
We have assumed that if a patient is on regular doses of 120mg morphine a day or above that they are likely to have also had
additional opioids for breakthrough pain.  This is why we have set the threshold at â‰¥120mg morphine equivalence per day.
Morphine equivalencies have been calculated using the from the Royal College of Anesthetists Faculty of Pain Medicine.
